module.name: issue_management
module.keywords: module, issue, issue management, issue resolution, disposition

abstract.li: Issue management enables the tracking of an issue though its assessment, disposition, and closing the loop to ensure that any consequential change actually resolves the issue.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the management of all information necessary to support the concepts associated with issues as they are identified, acted upon and resolved during the full life cycle of a system

inscope.li: facility to assign contract information to issue management data;
facility to assign product information to issue management data;
facility to assign product as realised information to issue management data;
facility to assign activity information to issue management data;
facility to assign activity method information to issue management data;
facility to assign person and organization information to issue management data;
facility to assign approval information to issue management data;
facility to assign certification information to issue management data;
facility to assign project information to issue management data;
facility to assign security information to issue management data;
facility to assign event information to issue management data;
facility to assign value with unit information to issue management data;

usage_guide.p: This module is constructed from several ISO/TS Application modules. The USE FROM connectivity associated with these modules are shown below in Figure 1 the AP233 Concept Map.
The modules shown within this figure that are primary contributors to AP233's schedule information modelling capability are:
The USE FROM connectivity between the modules associated with the "Activity" concept of Activity and Activity as realized is shown below in Figure 2 the Activity Concept Map.
The USE FROM connectivity between the modules associated with the "Authorization" concept of approval is shown below in Figure 3 the Authorization Concept Map.
The USE FROM connectivity between the modules associated with the "Where" concept of identification assignment is shown below in Figure 4 the Where Concept Map.
The USE FROM connectivity between the modules associated with the "Project" concept of work order and work request is shown below in Figure 5 the Authorization Concept Map.
The USE FROM connectivity between the modules associated with the "Issue-Risk-Group" concept of issue is shown below in Figure 6 the Authorization Concept Map.

Entries into the type extend lists stem from two primary needs; namely, harmonization with STEP AP's relevant to AP233 and satisfaction of AP233 needs. The first group of extends needed for harmonization are derived from the extend lists used within the following STEP modules - not used by AP233:

The extends associated with this grouping are all placed in type extend lists having one of the character strings "pmri", "os", "pb", "ws" or "ss" used the extensible select type's name. This module contains only contributions from this group.
